doc:
Jean Simmons https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean_Simmons 0 Jean Merilyn Simmons, OBE (31 January 1929 – 22 January 2010) was an English actress and singer. One of J. Arthur Rank's "well-spoken young starlets", she appeared predominantly in films, beginning with those made in Great Britain during and after the Second World War, followed mainly by Hollywood films from 1950 onwards.Simmons was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for Hamlet (1948), and won a Golden Globe Award for Best Actress for Guys and Dolls (1955). Other notable film appearances included Young Bess (1953), The Robe (1953), Elmer Gantry (1960), Spartacus (1960), and the 1969 film The Happy Ending, for which she was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Actress. She also won an Emmy Award for the 1983 miniseries The Thorn Birds. Jean_Merilyn_Simmons , OBE ( 31_January_1929 – 22_January_2010 ) was an_English_actress_and_singer . One of J._Arthur_Rank 's_"_well-spoken_young_starlets " , she appeared predominantly in films , beginning with those made in Great_Britain during_and_after the_Second_World_War , followed mainly by Hollywood_films from 1950_onwards.Simmons was_nominated for the_Academy_Award for Best Supporting_Actress for Hamlet_(_1948_) , and won a_Golden_Globe_Award for_Best_Actress for Guys_and_Dolls ( 1955_) . Other_notable_film_appearances included Young_Bess_(_1953_) , The_Robe_(_1953_) , Elmer_Gantry_(_1960_) , Spartacus_(_1960_) , and the_1969_film The_Happy_Ending , for which she was_nominated for the_Academy_Award for_Best_Actress . She also won an_Emmy_Award for the_1983_miniseries The_Thorn_Birds .
